title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A creamy Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. Simple yet incredibly flavorful.

instructions.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, cut pancetta into small cubes and cook in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain pasta and add to the skillet with pancetta (heat off).
Quickly pour egg mixture over hot pasta, tossing constantly. Add pasta water as needed for creaminess.

title: Thai Green Curry
description: A fragrant and spicy Thai curry with coconut milk, vegetables, and your choice of protein.

instructions.instruction: Heat a wok over high heat. Add thick coconut cream from the top of the can and fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add sliced chicken and stir-fry until nearly cooked through.
Pour in remaining coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add eggplant, bamboo shoots, and kaffir lime leaves. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar. Finish with fresh Thai basil.

title: Vegetarian Buddha Bowl
description: A nourishing bowl packed with roasted vegetables, quinoa, chickpeas, and tahini dressing.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cube sweet potato and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast sweet potato and drained chickpeas on a baking sheet for 25 minutes.
Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Steam broccoli until bright green and tender-crisp.
Make dressing by whisking tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and water until smooth.
Assemble bowls with quinoa, roasted vegetables, chickpeas, sliced avocado, and drizzle with tahini dressing.

title: Japanese Chicken Katsu
description: Crispy breaded chicken cutlets served with tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.

instructions.instruction: Pound chicken breasts to even thickness (about 1/2 inch). Season with salt and pepper.
Set up breading station: flour, beaten eggs, and panko in separate shallow dishes.
Coat each chicken piece in flour, then egg, then panko, pressing to adhere.
Heat oil in a large skillet to 350°F (175°C). Fry chicken 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.
Drain on paper towels, slice, and serve with shredded cabbage and tonkatsu sauce.

title: Mexican Street Tacos
description: Authentic street-style tacos with marinated carne asada, fresh cilantro, and onions on corn tortillas.

instructions.instruction: Marinate steak with lime juice, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, and salt for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear steak over high heat, 4-5 minutes per side for medium.
Let steak rest 5 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.
Warm tortillas on a dry skillet or directly over gas flame.
Assemble tacos with sliced steak, diced onion, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.

title: Indian Butter Chicken
description: Tender chicken in a rich, creamy tomato sauce with aromatic spices. A beloved Indian classic.

instructions.instruction: Marinate chicken in yogurt, half the garam masala, and salt for at least 2 hours (or overnight).
Grill or broil marinated chicken until charred and cooked through. Set aside.
Melt butter in a large pan. Sauté ginger-garlic paste until fragrant.
Add tomato puree and spices. Simmer for 15 minutes until sauce thickens.
Stir in cream and fenugreek leaves. Add chicken pieces and simmer 5 more minutes.

title: Greek Moussaka
description: A layered casserole of eggplant, spiced meat sauce, and creamy bechamel. Perfect comfort food.

instructions.instruction: Slice eggplants, salt them, and let drain for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Brush eggplant slices with oil and grill or bake until golden.
Brown lamb with onions, add tomatoes and cinnamon. Simmer 20 minutes.
Make bechamel: melt butter, whisk in flour, gradually add milk. Cook until thick. Stir in egg yolks and nutmeg.
Layer eggplant, meat sauce, more eggplant, then bechamel in a baking dish.
Bake at 350°F (180°C) for 45 minutes until golden and bubbling.

title: Vietnamese Pho
description: A deeply aromatic beef noodle soup with star anise, cinnamon, and fresh herbs.

instructions.instruction: Parboil beef bones for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse to remove impurities.
Char onion and ginger under broiler until blackened in spots.
Add bones, brisket, charred aromatics, star anise, and cinnamon to pot. Cover with water and simmer 3 hours.
Remove brisket when tender (about 2 hours), slice thinly. Strain broth and season with fish sauce.
Cook rice noodles according to package. Divide into bowls with sliced brisket.
Ladle hot broth over noodles. Serve with bean sprouts, basil, lime, and sauces.

title: Moroccan Lamb Tagine
description: Slow-cooked lamb with apricots, almonds, and warm spices in a traditional Moroccan style.

instructions.instruction: Cut lamb into large chunks. Season with ras el hanout, salt, and pepper.
Brown lamb in batches in a tagine or Dutch oven. Set aside.
Sauté sliced onions until soft. Add saffron bloomed in warm water.
Return lamb to pot with stock and cinnamon. Cover and simmer 1.5 hours.
Add apricots and honey. Cook 30 more minutes until lamb is tender.
Toast almonds and scatter over tagine. Garnish with fresh cilantro.

title: Korean Bibimbap
description: A colorful rice bowl topped with vegetables, meat, and a fried egg, served with gochujang sauce.

instructions.instruction: Cook rice according to package directions.
Slice beef thinly and marinate in soy sauce, sesame oil, and garlic.
Blanch spinach and bean sprouts separately. Season each with sesame oil and salt.
Julienne carrots and zucchini. Sauté each separately until just tender.
Sauté mushrooms and marinated beef until cooked.
Fry eggs sunny-side up. Assemble bowls with rice, arranged vegetables, beef, and egg. Serve with gochujang.

title: French Onion Soup
description: Rich beef broth with caramelized onions, topped with crusty bread and melted Gruyere cheese.

instructions.instruction: Slice onions thinly. Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat.
Cook onions slowly, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized (45-60 minutes).
Add wine and scrape up any browned bits. Cook until wine evaporates.
Add broth, thyme, and bay leaf. Simmer 20 minutes.
Slice and toast baguette rounds. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls.
Top each bowl with bread and grated Gruyere. Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden.

title: Shakshuka
description: Eggs poached in a spiced tomato and pepper sauce. A beloved Middle Eastern breakfast dish.

instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Sauté diced onion and peppers until soft.
Add minced garlic and spices. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Pour in tomatoes and simmer until sauce thickens slightly.
Make 6 wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each.
Cover and cook until egg whites are set but yolks are still runny.
Crumble feta over top and garnish with parsley. Serve with crusty bread.

title: Pad Thai
description: Thailand's most famous noodle dish with a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savory flavors.

instructions.instruction: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes until pliable. Drain.
Mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar to make the sauce.
Heat wok over high heat. Fry cubed tofu until golden. Set aside.
Stir-fry shrimp until pink. Push aside, scramble eggs in the same wok.
Add noodles and sauce. Toss until noodles are coated and slightly charred.
Add bean sprouts and chives. Serve with peanuts and lime wedges.

title: Classic Beef Stroganoff
description: Tender beef strips in a creamy mushroom sauce, served over egg noodles.

instructions.instruction: Slice beef into thin strips. Season with salt and pepper.
Sear beef in batches over high heat until browned. Set aside.
Sauté sliced mushrooms and diced onion in butter until golden.
Sprinkle flour over vegetables, stir, then add broth. Simmer until thickened.
Reduce heat, stir in sour cream and mustard. Return beef to pan.
Cook egg noodles. Serve stroganoff over noodles, garnished with parsley.

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells
description: Jumbo pasta shells filled with creamy ricotta and spinach, baked in marinara sauce.

instructions.instruction: Cook pasta shells according to package. Drain and cool.
Thaw and squeeze dry the spinach. Chop finely.
Mix ricotta, spinach, half the mozzarella, Parmesan, egg, garlic, and seasoning.
Spread half the marinara in a 9x13 baking dish.
Fill each shell with ricotta mixture and arrange in dish. Top with remaining sauce and mozzarella.
Cover and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 more minutes. Top with basil.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Grilled marinated chicken in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce. Britain's favorite curry.

instructions.instruction: Cut chicken into chunks. Marinate in yogurt, half the garam masala, and turmeric for 30 minutes.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill or broil until charred and cooked through.
Sauté diced onion in butter until soft. Add ginger-garlic paste and remaining spices.
Add tomatoes and simmer 15 minutes until sauce thickens.
Stir in cream and grilled chicken pieces. Simmer 5 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with basmati rice or naan.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy Italian rice dish with earthy mushrooms, white wine, and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.instruction: Heat broth and keep warm. Sauté mushrooms in olive oil until golden. Set aside.
Melt half the butter. Sauté minced shallots and garlic until soft.
Add rice and toast for 2 minutes. Pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly, allowing each addition to absorb before adding more.
When rice is al dente, stir in mushrooms, remaining butter, and Parmesan.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and thyme.

title: Fish Tacos with Mango Salsa
description: Crispy battered fish in soft tortillas topped with fresh mango salsa and creamy sauce.

instructions.instruction: Make mango salsa: dice mango, red onion, and jalapeno. Mix with chopped cilantro and lime juice.
Make chipotle crema: blend sour cream with chipotle and lime juice.
Cut fish into strips. Make batter by whisking flour, beer, and salt.
Dip fish in batter and fry in 375°F (190°C) oil until golden and crispy.
Warm tortillas on a dry skillet.
Assemble tacos with fish, mango salsa, chipotle crema, and extra cilantro.

title: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
description: A perfectly roasted whole chicken with crispy skin, infused with lemon and fresh herbs.

instructions.instruction: Remove chicken from fridge 30 minutes before cooking. Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Pat chicken dry. Rub with softened butter under and over the skin.
Stuff cavity with halved lemon, garlic head, and half the herbs.
Place chicken on quartered onion and carrots in roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil.
Roast for 1 hour 15 minutes until juices run clear and internal temp reaches 165°F (74°C).
Rest 10 minutes before carving. Serve with pan vegetables and juices.

title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Perfectly chewy chocolate chip cookies with crispy edges and gooey centers. A timeless American classic.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Cream softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to wet ingredients.
Fold in chocolate chips. Drop rounded tablespoons onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake 9-12 minutes until golden brown but still soft in center. Cool on pan 5 minutes.
